content: Doesn't play back the lines properly, it just stops playing halfway through my line. Clearly not working for android and should only be bought if you are an iphone user. Total garbage for Android users and should be pulled from the store.
Don't know how to delete My learn line learner looks different for what is posted online I do not have the apps at the bottom to change things around
Cant even hear the lines, the volume on this app is shocking.

Poor, poor, poor. While the concept is brilliant and the bits that work, work well, there are frustrations that have me looking elsewhere: 1. LL cuts out when a reminder pops up on my phone. Just stops dead. 2. Can't rename a script - its 'New script' for ever. 3. Can't create a second script at all. The only way I can record another script is to delete the existing and record the new, line by line. Bad luck if I want to retain them both, or heaven forbid 3 at once!

I can hardly hear anything on my samsung s9 even with head phones and my volume maxed out and the setting turned on for samsung and pixel phones. There isn't an easy way to skip back or ahead on lines. When I try to open the full instructions I get an error message saying the page is missing, same with the FAQs page. So far very unimpressed.
Brilliant and easy to use app to help learn your lines
Welldone, you broke the app. Its useless now and won't play back

Since upgrading to a Samsung S10 the sound on playback mode is inaudible. I notice I'm not the only one with this complaint (different phones too). Please advise. I loved this app before and hope it's not a ploy to encourage use of different apps now its bought and paid for.

Super useful for learning lines but quite buggy. Can't add scenes on the scene page, the app quits every time I try. Renaming scenes often has the same effect. If those bugs were removed, 5 stars for sure.
I really like this app but now I cannot get your app to create a new act II I wish you all would answer my
great app been using this many years for all line learning and studying exams

Not as reported. Will not read to voice downloaded content. Only downloads via google docs. You have to voice and record all characters. Tone doesn't change. No way to delete mistakes. Wasted $3.99 doing this, and can't get a refund now.
Can't import PDF files. It says to go find the PDF import on the play store but nothing comes up.

I can shout my lines into the phone and when I play it back it sounds like whispers no matter how high I turn the volume up on my phone. Everything in settings is fine, volume is up,permissions granted, it still wont play at full volume.

This is one of the greatest tools I have for learning lines. I spend a lot of time driving and once set this app runs itself hands free. I love a recently added feature for speed reading of lines. Awesome.

WHY IS THE SOUND PLAYBACK SO LOW?!?!?! I used to use this app SO much on my old iphone. I must have recommended this app to every actor I've ever met. It's that good. Made for actors with all the features you'd need. Just switched to a samsung S10 (which I love) but what's up with the android version of this app? Recorded audio is soooooo quiet that it's useless. I've tried recording in various ways and it's still so quiet. Why????? PLEASE FIX THIS. Otherwise the app is dope.

I have an Android (Samsung S9) and I've watched all the tutorials and I cannot get the PDF to upload!! I am beyond annoyed and I purchased this app. I don't even see the option now to enter the text manually!! Please advise ASAP!!

This app has been a lifesaver for me and is wonderful for practicing my lines while commuting. I love the recent update that allows me to speed up the other actors. It really helps me get through the script faster!!!
This app works brilliantly. Any previous issues with the app or enhancements only available on Apple seem to have been rectified. Happy to give this 5 stars again!
Volume? I can barely hear the playback. And can't see where there is anything in settings to adjust volume.
Horrible layout, difficult to use, unclear and incomplete directions
Difficult to upload a pdf. Not super user friendly.
Hilariously overcomplicates what should be a simple process of dictation. Worth a punt. Uninstalled.
absolute waste of money. too complicated. just record your prompts on your phone.
its cool..just wish you could delete whole scenes at once

I paid for this app because of the ability to change the pitch of lines which weren't mine, so I could differentiate between them. there seems to have been an update which removed this functionality, making it pretty much useless for me. could you bring this back please!
Keeps losing scenes - recorded content disappears. Was terrific, now terrible. Very disappointing

Best ap I've found for rehearsing lines. It will play back in multiple voices, and editing recordings is quick and easy. The multitude of playback options (leave gap for your line, play it after gap) makes it perfect for use in whatever phase you are in the learning process.
Difficult to navigate, hard to import scripts, insctirctions are poor. It is not possible to use.
DO NOT use this app if you have an Android. It does not work and is a completely different interface than for Apple devices. It was clearly developed for Apple devices and development stopped there.

This is a wonderful app - has the skeleton an actor needs to flesh out the character and learn lines incredibly fast! The only thing I might add is a section for wardrobe notes for various scenes. Great app - thanks!
disappointing! the app wouldn't skip the me lines. Such a waste!

the app wouldn't import my script from Google drive or even give me the option to download from any of my other apps and kept telling me to download the line learner import option from google play store which doesn't seem to exist i did try several times. if I wanted to manually input a script I'd use one of the free options sorry to leave such a review but these bugs need to be addressed
Fine for recording lines, but the functions within don't seem to work on Android (e.g. play only my lines, play only a certain scene etc.)
When I try to import a pdf from Google Drive I get an error message that I should use the pdf import function. If there is another import function than the one I'm using, I'm not finding it.
Can you PLEASE fix the Bluetooth issue with the lines skipping!?! People have been complaining of this issue for nearly a year and NO update.
It simply does not work for my purposes. I'm sure it is fine for others, but not me.
This says it is installed on my device.  I can't find it anywhere

when I went to play after recording none of the audio played back in play mode, all my character lines disappeared and most of the audio was silence. no easy way to even report bugs. it kinda sorta works but too buggy. nothing like wasting an hour and money.

App still has the issue of skipping over the other characters' lines when audio is connected via Bluetooth. To see that reviews were mentioning this over a year ago as of 01/19/19 and nothing has changed, might be a sign the developers have abandoned this app.

App doesn't contain the speed up/slow down feature. Feel like I paid for a partial app. Response from the developer: "Unfortunately the speed up and slow down feature is only available on Apple devices as Android does not provide that capability. The speed up and slow down feature is such a small part of the app, and it doesn't really affect how it works at all."
Keeps skipping. Frustrating, I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling, but still skips lines
The app keeps skipping some, not all, of the "them" lines. Incredibly frustrating will be requesting a refund.

There are a few things you may need to do, to make this work. If the recording using the default settings doesn't work, change it to the old format, that should give a better playback volume. Also, if you have a headset with mic, use that to record, so you can have the phone on the table whilst reading the script and pressing the buttons, as it can get messy trying to do it all on your lap. But once you've got around that niggle, the app works as described and I'm very happy with it.
It's good but the UI needs alot of work.

Came back to this app after a couple of years. User interface is so, so confusing. Had to have a play to try and work out how to do what I wanted. When I finally got that done and started playing my recordings back, it was very quiet despite my sound being turned right up. Easier to use default voice recorder.
replyContent:
Hi Dylan,
Thank you for your feedback. I have now released a complete re-write of the app that hopefully answers all your issues, and adds a load more features.
Best regards
AlldayApps support

content: I purchased this app about two years ago and I love it. I am in my third year at college as a theatre major and I would not be able to get everything done without this app. Twice now, I have stepped into a show super last minute (1-2 weeks before opening) and this app has helped me to get off book in about 2 days. I'm sure with more frequent use I would be able to do it even quicker. As my roommate says, I "swear by it." I use the app to learn my lines for every show I'm in as well as scenes for class, and it makes learning lines super easy. I have not been able to figure out how to import a script, but I find that speaking the lines to record them helps me learn them even faster, although it is a little time consuming to get the app set up for each new scene or show.

This app may not be fancy, but it sure is nifty, and it's excellent at its 
main job - getting you off book as soon as possible.

Unfortunately lines get lost quite a lot which makes it very frustrating to 
use. If more reliable it would be amazing.

What a waste of money. Get Script Rehearser. It's free and you can upload a 
script PLUS a lot of the functions that this one has.
The app is clunky and un-intuitive, but boy, does it do the job! As a professional opera singer, this app has been a godsend for learning huge amounts of recitative and dialogue.

Best tool for learning lines..easy to use and i love the integration with audition pro full self tape system on ipad..congrats i never leave feedback so this is a first. Also support very responsive! Next best thing to a live setting.

Ok... I love the functionality and idea behind this app but it is SO glitchy. I paid for this app that has a notification bar but you can't click on it? Can you also add play and pause buttons to it when the phone is locked? Also, it is glitching out when I play 'their' line and it skips over their line constantly.

One of the least intuitive apps I've used in a long time, just feels like you're running in circles, getting nowhere.  Importing from Dropbox doesn't work as the app doesn't register itself as an option.  Waited too long to apply for a refund.
I was loving it but it keeps looking lines....i re record them but they still won't play. It's very frustrating.

I purchased the line learner app a year ago and found it very helpful in learning lines once I got the hang of the apps little quirks.  I would like to give it a high rating, but I find that the bluetooth volume in my car is so low that I can't hear them regardless of having the stereo volume up to max as well as the phone.  (Maybe that's why many other low app raters think bluetooth doesn't work?)  I'm not sure what's going on with the recording volume, but if it could be corrected I'd be very happy to recommend to all my theater friends.
It's no longer working for me. No volume and crashes plus losing lines

2 stars cuz I can't connect to audio via Bluetooth and have the app still work. I'm not the 1st person with this issue and the bug needs to be fixed. This app is next to useless without being able to listen to lines on the go. It's 2018, people's headphones, speakers, and cars all and often connect to phones via Bluetooth.
Won't play back lines. They run but no sound......junk...
Crashes continuously when changes character on record shame
It is hard to figure out it and I still haven't figured out how to properly record the characters lines yet.

Six months ago, I gave the app 5 stars - brilliant. But in the my break between shows there has clearly been an update that included a bug that screws with the app when connected to Bluetooth - it skips lines at random, says lines at random and is all around super frustrating. It works fine when not connected, but considering that 80% of my reason for buying (yes, paying money for, which I rarely do) LL was to learn lines in my car, this is a big problem. I'd happily give them their 5 stars back if they can fix it (without messing anything else up).

I've used this app for years now, because unfortunately it's the best app we Android actors are going to get (Rehearsal has no plans of debuting in Android). It's not a very reliable app. It has the nasty habit of picking a specific character's lines, after I've recorded the whole script, and deleting any audio associated with them. The line will still show up in the app, it will just skip it when played, as if it was a sound clip zero seconds long. This has been frustrating at best, disastrous at worst.
Helped me learn my lines. A good tutorial would be helpful.
Character's lines bug out when connected to bluetooth. Lines will skip or the voices will change. Practicing lines in the car is why i got this app and this bug prevents that.

This is a pretty good app once you get used to the interface.  The ability to share scripts with others is really nice. It also works well to move scripts between devices--both Android and iOS.     I've had some issue with it jumping lines, which makes it harder to learn.    I'd like the option to add photos to represent characters that is on the iOS version.

The UI is terrible - you have to switch screens to do the most basic of things (such as re-order lines). Main problem for me is it's stubborn refusal to playback certain lines - the app just stalls and waits. Not all lines, just some. Makes it imposdible to use. There's a kernel of a good idea here, but lacks finesse and stability. Shame 😞
I love this app. In the last 12 months alone, I have got 3 jobs; in Munich, Berlin and Bucharest.  All got with self tapes using this app as the other actors.
Doesn't have an option to delete scripts, constantly crashes when trying to import a PDF, not user friendly. Uninstalled. Can't believe I wasted my money with this.

The best tool for learning lines by yourself, hands down. I've used it for years and after my first technical problem this week I contacted customer service. They responded within 24 hours and had released an update fixing my problem within 48. Fantastic responsiveness.
Had Audio problems, just the best support and comms.. all fixed now!  Thank you so much!
It keeps telling me "failed to record audio". Making it absolutely useless. Please fix ASAP.
I and heavily involved in community theater and I've used this for the last two plays I was in. I do not have to depend on anyone else to help me learn lines. I love it!
Rubbish. It didn't even appear on my phone but kept telling me its installing soon. What a crock
I am frustrated with this app. The creator of the app has been really kind  and helpful. Who knows it may just be my not so smart phone.
I can add the first 2 but when I swipe for a new character nothing happens
Dont get me wrong, this app is pretty good but you'll have to have a bachelors degree just to figure out how to use it. Make it more user friendly for an updated review.

I literally tell every actor I know about this. Super helpful when you have new sides and have no time (cause you have to see hair/makeup) I record my lines with prompts and away I go. The ability to have both sides, play them, leave a gap. Or do both (to make sure your word perfect) just amazing!
It used to work fine but an automatic update messed it up and I'm desperately trying to uninstall and re install , even prepared to pay again but it's not working!!!! Frustrating
Easy to use. Very helpful in learning lines
It would really cool, if we can have distinction in voices, e.g., male or female, high pitch and low pitch voice, to easy identify which voices belong to who.
App constantly repeats lines and jumping and missing lines and prompts. Total waste of money. The developer should be ashamed
Just love this app

I would love this if it would allow me to delete scenes and scripts without having to go to the Record Screen and delete lines one by one. The instructions say that it's possible but it's not with this version that I have on my Sony Xperia. I look forward to the update that fixes this!

This is not an intuitive program and very limited in functionality compared to Script Rehearser which is free. Near as I can tell after figuring out how to import a PDF it only displays it. It does not parse it like Script Rehearser. But the program is so hard to figure out how to use it might write the script for you for all I know. Really dis pointed in this app. I don't want to record voices so I think it's best for people who do want to do that.
The android version is terrible in comparison to the iPhone one. They can control the speed of play, which is something that would be really helpful!

Not the smoothest app in the world, but the idea is awesome and it's a brilliant tool for drilling lines, dont expect to be able to get to performance level with it, but it will get the words to stick!

It seems that no matter how much I try to change a scene's speech pattern (i.e., gaps-lines, no gaps, etc.), it doesn't do that when I then return to the scene.  It's "obstinate" about sticking with the configuration it had before.  Maybe an update caused this or an update is needed to correct?

Fairly good but skips lines randomly in android (really bad for your lines confidence) and remains on in playback mode when you take a call meaning you have to hang up - switch off the playback and call the person back. You also can't get into the app via the system drop down. Lower than the standard you would expect from a free app not one you pay for.

Granted, it's not the most intuitive of apps, but I found my way around it quickly. There is a tutorial available online, but I didn't really need to refer to it. Having just taken on one of the lead parts in a play, this app has helped me to learn a lot of my lines much quicker than I expected. Also saves my family from having to run lines with me, and means I can now use my car commute to learn lines, too.

I had the lead and center role with over 600 lines.  With this app, I arrived to the first rehearsal off book.  If you can find the record button you can make use of it.   Watch the tutorials on YouTube.  They help compensate for small bits of awkward interfacing.  But find the record mic and you're good to go.  If you pay attention, the interface is only odd occasionally.  Love it !
It's its not very intuitive. Would benefit from a tutorial and an option, in Android, to change pitch on other voices so you can distinguish lines better
I bought this app specifically for the ability to prompt the other person's lines, but the settings would never save and it would never pause after the gap like I told it to. Doesn't suit my needs.
Was working fine this morning then abruptly started repeating lines rather than playing the next one... not very useful... potential bug on samsung galaxy s4?

A lot of great features for memorizing lines. However the navigation is kind of confusing. Apparently the iPhone version let's you change the voice pitch of characters but I can't see that for Android.
I had to get a refund! It was impossible to navigate!!!
Horrible.  Nothing as advertised.  I want my money back.

I loved this app, had it on my iPhone for over a year and boy did it ever come in handy! It is a little difficult to navigate but if you play around with it, you'll get it. BUT! I am devastated that the Android vsn does not allow pitch changes for the  characters!  This is one of the main reasons I paid for it twice instead of going with a different program and now I don't even have that capability. Unless someone else records the other lines there is no differentiation between lines. PLEASE FIX THIS!!
I think this app still has a lot of bugs that need to be tweak. It's cool though but I don't think it's user friendly. Especially how the input format is designed.

Buggy. No Demo. Recommend Avoid. There are so many bugs in this which helps me understand why they do not provide a demo or lite version. 1) Unable to select from pull down menu when it is open but has been moved to the background. Must use recent. 2) Shuts off after a few minutes of the screen being off. I have it set like other apps to remain on even if the screen is off but it doesn't. What makes this even more frustrating is that it goes back to the first line for that session and not the place where it stopped. 3) Beginning of lines is sometimes cut off. 4) The interface is awkward to use and some features show up in one place but not another. 5) 11/18/15 - I tried to exit but it kept playing in the background. I started it again and assumed that when I pressed play it would start playing that and stop the other one. Now it played both.  The only positive is that you can record individual lines and play them back in various ways. I should have followed my normal plan of avoiding apps with very few installed. This was recommended by a fellow actor who "heard" that it was good. They will all be hearing that it's bad from me. I would recommend looking for another app.
I hope you keep updating

It took me a really long time to figure out how it worked when I got it. I was reading the tutorials and it still took a while. Now, I just want to read a script my director sent me and it keeps opening in this app. I don't want that and it won't change!! It won't even put it in the app so I can look at it. Can you please change this? And if not then will uninstalling it fix the problem? I don't want to feel like I wasted money :(
I was willing to give this another star, only be cause it worked all right but with a few kinks. Now with the latest update, it has erased my script. Thanks a lot. Boo.

This app has lots of options but the functionality seems limited. I'm only able to have one script. I am not able to add a "new script", "rename script", "rename scene", "add scene", or "add character".
Ridiculously buggy, terrible workflow, the record and stop record process just doesn't work properly on my phone (HTC M9). Uninstalling, please refund me.

It does everything you expect it to do, and then some! It considerably reduced the time it takes me to memorize my lines. Some users think it's too complicated, but then again, there are people that find texting or skyping is too complicated.. with a little time and effort you will discover and appreciate its great potential.

The developer needs to really analyze the workflow and use cases.  I am a software engineer myself and I can't for the life of me figure it out, even after reading the online help.  When I open a PDF from Google Drive, it jumps to the app, showing me a list of the plays I have, giving NO indication of whether it imported the PDF, and whether it imported it to an existing play?  Is it waiting for me to enter a new play?  No evidence the import worked.  Changing things like character names, Enter new name, nothing indicating it 'saved'.  Go back, and the character name is back to 'Me'.  Figured out I had to enter the name and then hit 'change name'.  This is just a VERY, VERY painful user interface.  A re-think is required.  I am discouraged and getting a refund.
Out how to enter lines. Please create a how to use FAQ! Or give me my money back!!!
Like previous review,  way too complicated.  Waste of money.

Way too complicated. You had it right and then screwed it up. Can not figure it out. Dump your updates as they are not needed. Go back to last year's easy version. It was good. This one is too complicated. You blew it. Looking for another one that is simple. Thanks for screwing up a good app.
I love it and it has helped me so much!

I have been using LineLearner to run through my script and all I say is that this is exceptional! Being able to run lines without needing someone on book is a dream come true and I have recommended this as a MUST BUY app to all of my fellow actors. Thank you so very much!
It does what you need it to, but you'd be better off using a free audio app and cueing up lines from a recording.

Recording is clean and I can sort my script quickly with the editor. It's fast and easy to swipe! That said, the interface is pretty daunting. It took me forever to figure out how to import PDFs. It works, but how would I know to go into my file explorer, and open with LineLearner? There should be a clean import option with a file finder. Also, there should be a clean way to exit the app. I press back, and it confusingly toggles between modes. On the left side of the mode at the bottom there should be an exit option.The "hamburger" option is context sensitive and powerful, but it's not easy to wrap your head around if you are running it for the first time. Also, sometimes on playback instead of adding the gap at the beginning or end of my line, it pauses in the middle of my recording. That said, I use this on both iOS and Android and tell everyone I know to figure out how to use this thing. It's invaluable!
Really like this app... definitely assists with lines learning. Thank you :)

It would often play the same line for multiple lines. If you paused it and went to a different line and hit play, it would continue the old line. Many other bugs happened. I will just stick with my recorder.

Aside from a few minor glitches, this is simply a great app. Easy to use and intuitive. Lots of control. And support for the minor problem I had was almost instantaneous. I already have my first script recorded.
The app started crashing. Lost lines. Now it won't open. I needed this. It let me down.
replyContent: Roger, if you get in touch with support@alldayapps.com I will do what I can to fix your problems. Best regards LineLearner support

content: Many improvements over the original. Much nicer to look at. Easier to use. More functionality. An excellent app. The developer is responsive and helpful.  I heartily recommend this app.
Had all my lines everything for my play and after the update I LOST EVERYTHING. WHY WHY WHY WHY. Now I have to redo everything. This sucks
replyContent:
Hi Tanya, I'm really sorry that you lost your lines.  If you get in touch with support@alldayapps.com then I am hopeful that we can get your lines back.
best regards
AlldayApps support

content: Brilliant upgrade. Thank you!
Wow!  This app is so easy to use and has all the tools to really make it helpful.  Wish we had found it earlier
"New scene" button doesn't work, "selecting" script takes you the rename screen, generally clunky in design.
replyContent:
Hi Christopher,

The app has now been completely re-written from the ground up (at version 6), with a full re-design.  Hopefully you should now find it a big improvement, and meeting your expectations.

content: It works when you have put in all your lines, but the editing tool deletes lines randomly, so you have to put them all back in. This may only work if you have a small amount of lines, but even then I would use another app or another way to memorize lines.
replyContent:
Hi Ben,

There is now a new version of the app (v6) that meets all of your issues, and I hope that you will find it useful.
Best regards
AlldayApps support

content: It seems that the re record feature is not working. The option appears but when I touch the button it does nothing.  Also I'm very confused as to how to load a script. When adding a script it only allows me to name it but no way of actually adding the script.
replyContent:
Hi Brandy,

There is now a completely new version of the app that was re-written from the ground up.  I hope that you will try it out and find it meets all your requirements.
Best regards
AlldayApps support

content: This app helped teach my son his school play lines. It worked well! It does need to have an option to keep the screen on while you are rehearsing, otherwise, very good.
Basic, easy to use, and quite simply the best app ever. The Actors 'Holy Grail'....a genuine way of easily learning lines !!

I feel like I’ve found gold with this app.  I thought I was going to have to hire an app developer to make my own line memorization tool, but lo!, I do not.  I work by recording all lines of text in monotone and replaying to learn by rote with voice memos.  I have always wanted to be able to silence out my own lines in the recording to fill them in myself and this app does it!  And when you forget your line, you hit “Prompt” (could say ‘Line?!’, like how an actor calls out) and it plays your next line.  Boom.  It can even be set to play your line AFTER a pause of same length, so you can double-check.  It’s functionally exactly what I was looking for.  I docked a star because I find the interface somewhat confusing (and unattractive on Android v. iOS) and the workflow for editing not intuitive (not being able to playback/preview a line in the editing page, for example, when we don’t know line numbers).  I expect this app to develop  beautifully with feedback and as the word spreads. It’s basically having a scene reader in your pocket.  You could even record with the other actors for extra fancy times.

The flow to correct a bad line read is pretty error pone and awkward.  It would be much more fluid if we mess up a line during a recording, if we could just long press the line entry to go into the edit screen, once done, let us back out to the recording list again where we we're so we can just continue.  With the way it is now, I have to leave the recording list, to go into the edit list, scroll down ( often accidentally deleting or moving and entry in the process)   then press the correct line to edit to get to the point of rerecording a line.  At the very least it would be nice to have a conformation on deleting a line.  Thanks for your efforts, each version is getting better...thanks for the menu when going "back"
replyContent:
Hi Jonas,
Thank you for the feedback. There is now a new version of the app, which was a complete re-write, and answers your issues.  I hope you find it useful.

best regards
AlldayApps

content: I have used it on iOS in the past, and it has been invaluable. A little finicky, but still really useful. I no longer have an iOS device, and so went looking for something like this.. and here it is! I haven't used it much yet, on my phone, but here is a little feedback from the little I have used it so far:  Non-functioning back button... sucks. Even if back took you to the menu screen... it is such an instinctual action for me.  I am a little nervous as the "Instructions" mentions that the Android version isn't as feature rich as the iOS.   Still... I look forward to getting a chance in the next few days to start recording my lines and cues!
Excellent app for learning your lines
